description: Use the MailGun API to access the product's features, such as sending E-Mails, webhooks, Email Validation etc.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: This API allows you to create, access, and delete webhooks programmatically.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

blocks.name: sendEmail
blocks.description: Sends an email.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Mailgun account contain email domain.

args.name: mFrom
args.info: Email address for From header.

args.name: mTo
args.info: Email address of the recipient(s). ('Bob bob@host.com'). You can use commas to separate multiple recipients.

args.name: cc
args.info: Same as 'To' but for Cc.

args.name: bcc
args.info: Same as 'To' but for Bcc.

args.name: subject
args.info: Message subject.

args.name: text
args.info: Body of the message. (text version).

args.name: html
args.info: Body of the message. (HTML version).

args.name: inline
args.info: Attachment with inline disposition.

args.name: o:tag
args.info: Tag string.

args.name: o:campaign
args.info: Id of the campaign the message belongs to. See um-campaign-analytics for details.

args.name: o:dkim
args.info: Enables/disables DKIM signatures on per-message basis. Pass yes or no.

args.name: o:deliverytime
args.info: Desired time of delivery. See Date Format. Note: Messages can be scheduled for a maximum of 3 days in the future.

args.name: o:testmode
args.info: Enables sending in test mode. Pass yes if needed. See Sending in Test Mode.

args.name: o:tracking
args.info: Toggles tracking on a per-message basis, see Tracking Messages for details. Pass yes or no.

args.name: o:tracking-clicks
args.info: Toggles clicks tracking on a per-message basis. Has higher priority than domain-level setting. Pass yes, no or htmlonly.

args.name: o:tracking-opens
args.info: Toggles opens tracking on a per-message basis. Has higher priority than domain-level setting. Pass yes or no.

args.name: o:require-tls
args.info: This requires the message only be sent over a TLS connection. (True or False)

args.name: o:skip-verification
args.info: If set to True, the certificate and hostname will not be verified when trying to establish a TLS connection and Mailgun will accept any certificate during delivery.

args.name: h:X-My-Header
args.info: h: prefix followed by an arbitrary value allows to append a custom MIME header to the message (X-My-Header in this case).

args.name: v:my-var
args.info: v: prefix followed by an arbitrary name allows to attach a custom JSON data to the message. See Attaching Data to Messages for more information.

blocks.name: sendEmailMIME
blocks.description: Posts a message in MIME format.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Mailgun account contain email domain.

args.name: mFrom
args.info: Email address for From header.

args.name: mTo
args.info: Email address of the recipient(s). ('Bob bob@host.com'). You can use commas to separate multiple recipients.

args.name: cc
args.info: Same as 'To' but for Cc.

args.name: bcc
args.info: Same as 'To' but for Bcc.

args.name: subject
args.info: Message subject.

args.name: text
args.info: Body of the message. (text version).

args.name: html
args.info: Body of the message. (HTML version).

args.name: inline
args.info: Attachment with inline disposition.

args.name: o:tag
args.info: Tag string.

args.name: o:campaign
args.info: Id of the campaign the message belongs to. See um-campaign-analytics for details.

args.name: o:dkim
args.info: Enables/disables DKIM signatures on per-message basis. Pass yes or no.

args.name: o:deliverytime
args.info: Desired time of delivery. See Date Format. Note: Messages can be scheduled for a maximum of 3 days in the future.

args.name: o:testmode
args.info: Enables sending in test mode. Pass yes if needed. See Sending in Test Mode.

args.name: o:tracking
args.info: Toggles tracking on a per-message basis, see Tracking Messages for details. Pass yes or no.

args.name: o:tracking-clicks
args.info: Toggles clicks tracking on a per-message basis. Has higher priority than domain-level setting. Pass yes, no or htmlonly.

args.name: o:tracking-opens
args.info: Toggles opens tracking on a per-message basis. Has higher priority than domain-level setting. Pass yes or no.

args.name: o:require-tls
args.info: This requires the message only be sent over a TLS connection. (True or False)

args.name: o:skip-verification
args.info: If set to True, the certificate and hostname will not be verified when trying to establish a TLS connection and Mailgun will accept any certificate during delivery.

args.name: h:X-My-Header
args.info: h: prefix followed by an arbitrary value allows to append a custom MIME header to the message (X-My-Header in this case).

args.name: v:my-var
args.info: v: prefix followed by an arbitrary name allows to attach a custom JSON data to the message. See Attaching Data to Messages for more information.

blocks.name: getStoredMessages
blocks.description: Returns stored messages.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Mailgun account contain email domain.

args.name: begin
args.info: The beginning of the search time range. It can be specified as a string (see Date Format) or linux epoch seconds.

args.name: end
args.info: The end of the search time range. It can be specified as a string (see Date Format) or linux epoch seconds.

args.name: ascending
args.info: Defines the direction of the search time range and must be provided if the range end time is not specified. Can be either yes or no.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of entries to return. (300 max)

blocks.description: Returns accepted messages.

args.name: ascending

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of entries to return. (300 max)

blocks.name: getAllStats
blocks.description: Returns total stats for a given domain.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Mailgun account contain email domain.

args.name: event
args.info: The type of the event.

args.name: start
args.info: The starting time. Should be in unix epoch format.

args.name: end
args.info: The ending date. Should be in unix epoch format.

args.name: resolution
args.info: Can be either hour, day or month. Default: day

args.name: duration
args.info: Period of time with resoluton encoded.

blocks.name: getEventStats
blocks.description: Returns a list of event stats items. Each record represents counts for one event per one day.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of records to return. (100 by default)

args.name: skip
args.info: Number of records to skip.

args.name: event
args.info: Name of the event to receive the stats for. Note that you can specify this parameter multiple times to fetch stats for several events at the same time.

args.name: startDate
args.info: The date to receive the stats starting from. Should have ISO8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).

blocks.name: getAllTags
blocks.description: Returns a list of tags for a domain. Provides with the pagination urls if the result set is to long to be returned in a single response.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of records to return. (100 by default)

blocks.name: getSingleTag
blocks.description: Returns a list of tags for a domain. Provides with the pagination urls if the result set is to long to be returned in a single response.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: tag
args.info: Name of the tag.

blocks.name: updateTag
blocks.description: Updates a given tag with the information provided.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: tag
args.info: Name of the tag.

args.name: description
args.info: Optional description of a tag.

blocks.name: getTagStats
blocks.description: Returns statistics for a given tag.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: tag
args.info: Name of the tag.

args.name: event
args.info: The type of the event.

args.name: start
args.info: The starting time. Should be in unix epoch format.

args.name: end
args.info: The ending date. Should be in unix epoch format.

args.name: resolution
args.info: Can be either hour, day or month. Default: day

args.name: duration
args.info: Period of time with resoluton encoded.

blocks.name: deleteTag
blocks.description: Deletes the tag. The statistics for the tag are not destroyed.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: tag
args.info: Name of the tag.

blocks.name: getAllBounces
blocks.description: Paginate over a list of bounces for a domain.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of records to return (optional, default: 100, max: 10000)

blocks.name: getSingleBounce
blocks.description: Fetch a single bounce event by a given email address. Useful to check if a given email address has bounced before.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address

blocks.name: addBounce
blocks.description: Add a bounce record to the bounce list. Updates the existing record if the address is already there.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

args.name: code
args.info: Error code

args.name: error
args.info: Error description (default: empty string)

args.name: createdAt
args.info: Timestamp of a bounce event.

blocks.name: addMultipleBounces
blocks.description: Add multiple bounce records to the bounce list in a single API call.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: bounces
args.info: Records to the bounce list.

blocks.name: deleteBounce
blocks.description: Clears a given bounce event. The delivery to the deleted email address resumes until it bounces again.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

blocks.name: deleteBounceList
blocks.description: Clears all bounced email addresses for a domain. Delivery to the deleted email addresses will no longer be suppressed.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

blocks.name: getAllUnsubscribes
blocks.description: Paginate over a list of unsubscribes for a domain.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of records to return (optional, default: 100, max: 10000).

blocks.name: getSingleUnsubscribeRecord
blocks.description: Fetch a single unsubscribe record. Can be used to check if a given address is present in the list of unsubscribed users.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

blocks.name: addAddressToUnsubscribeTable
blocks.description: Add an address to the unsubscribe table.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

args.name: tag
args.info: Tag to unsubscribe from, use * to unsubscribe an address from all domain’s correspondence (optional, default: *)

args.name: createdAt
args.info: Timestamp of a bounce event.

blocks.name: addMultipleUnsubscribeRecords
blocks.description: Add multiple unsubscribe records to the unsubscribe list in a single API call.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: unsubscribeList
args.info: Unsubscribe list

structure.name: tag
structure.info: Tag to unsubscribe from, use * to unsubscribe an address from all domain’s correspondence (optional, default: *)

blocks.name: deleteUnsubscribeRecords
blocks.description: Remove an address from the unsubscribes list. If tag parameter is not provided, completely removes an address from the list.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

args.name: tag
args.info: Specific tag to remove.

blocks.name: getAllComplaints
blocks.description: Paginate over a list of complaints for a domain.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of records to return (optional, default: 100, max: 10000)

blocks.name: getSingleComplaint
blocks.description: Fetch a single spam complaint by a given email address. This is useful to check if a particular user has complained.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

blocks.name: addSingleComplaint
blocks.description: Add an address to the complaints list.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

args.name: createdAt
args.info: Timestamp of a bounce event.

blocks.name: addMultipleComplaints
blocks.description: Add an address to the complaints list.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: complaints
args.info: Complaints array

blocks.name: deleteComplaint
blocks.description: Remove a given spam complaint.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: domain
args.info: Name of the domain.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

blocks.name: getAllRoutes
blocks.description: Fetches the list of routes. Note that routes are defined globally, per account, not per domain as most of other API calls.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of records to return. (100 by default).

args.name: skip
args.info: Number of records to skip. (0 by default).

blocks.name: getSingleRoute
blocks.description: Returns a single route object based on its ID.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: routeId
args.info: ID of the route.

blocks.name: createRoute
blocks.description: Creates a new route.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: priority
args.info: Integer: smaller number indicates higher priority. Higher priority routes are handled first. Defaults to 0.

args.name: description
args.info: An arbitrary string.

args.name: expression
args.info: A filter expression like match_recipient('.*@gmail.com').

args.name: action
args.info: Route action. This action is executed when the expression evaluates to True. Example: forward('alice@example.com')

blocks.name: updateRoute
blocks.description: Updates a given route by ID. All parameters are optional: this API call only updates the specified fields leaving others unchanged.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: routeId
args.info: ID of the route.

args.name: priority
args.info: Integer: smaller number indicates higher priority. Higher priority routes are handled first. Defaults to 0.

args.name: description
args.info: An arbitrary string.

args.name: expression
args.info: A filter expression like match_recipient('.*@gmail.com').

args.name: action
args.info: Route action. This action is executed when the expression evaluates to True. Example: forward('alice@example.com')

blocks.name: deleteRoute
blocks.description: Deletes a route based on the id.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: routeId
args.info: ID of the route.

blocks.name: getAllMailingLists
blocks.description: Paginate over mailing lists under your account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of records to return (optional, default: 100, max: 10000)

blocks.name: getSingleMailingList
blocks.description: Returns a single mailing list by a given address.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: address
args.info: Valid email address

blocks.name: createMailingList
blocks.description: Creates a new mailing list.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: address
args.info: A valid email address for the mailing list, e.g. developers@mailgun.net, or Developers <devs@mg.net>

args.name: name
args.info: Mailing list name, e.g. Developers.

args.name: description
args.info: A description.

args.name: accessLevel
args.info: List access level, one of: readonly (default), members, everyone

blocks.name: updateMailingList
blocks.description: Update mailing list properties, such as address, description or name

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: email
args.info: A valid email address for the mailing list, e.g. developers@mailgun.net, or Developers <devs@mg.net>

args.name: address
args.info: New mailing list address, e.g. devs@mg.net

args.name: name
args.info: Mailing list name, e.g. Developers.

args.name: description
args.info: A description.

args.name: accessLevel
args.info: List access level, one of: readonly (default), members, everyone

blocks.name: deleteMailingList
blocks.description: Deletes a mailing list.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: email
args.info: A valid email address for the mailing list, e.g. developers@mailgun.net, or Developers <devs@mg.net>

blocks.name: getMailingListMembers
blocks.description: Paginate over list members in the given mailing list

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: address
args.info: A valid email address for the mailing list, e.g. developers@mailgun.net, or Developers <devs@mg.net>

args.name: subscribed
args.info: yes to lists subscribed, no for unsubscribed. list all if not set

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of records to return (optional, default: 100, max: 10000)

blocks.name: getSingleMailingListMember
blocks.description: Retrieves a mailing list member.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: address
args.info: A valid email address for the mailing list, e.g. developers@mailgun.net, or Developers <devs@mg.net>

args.name: memberAddress
args.info: Member email-address

blocks.name: addMemberToMailingList
blocks.description: Adds a member to the mailing list.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: address
args.info: A valid email address for the mailing list, e.g. developers@mailgun.net, or Developers <devs@mg.net>

args.name: name
args.info: Optional member name.

args.name: vars
args.info: JSON-encoded dictionary string with arbitrary parameters, e.g. {'gender':'female','age':27}

args.name: subscribed
args.info: yes to add as subscribed (default), no as unsubscribed

args.name: upsert
args.info: yes to update member if present, no to raise error in case of a duplicate member (default)

blocks.name: updateMember
blocks.description: Updates a mailing list member with given properties.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: address
args.info: A valid email address for the mailing list, e.g. developers@mailgun.net, or Developers <devs@mg.net>

args.name: memberAddress
args.info: Member email-address

args.name: name
args.info: Optional member name.

args.name: vars
args.info: JSON-encoded dictionary string with arbitrary parameters, e.g. {'gender':'female','age':27}

args.name: subscribed
args.info: yes to add as subscribed (default), no as unsubscribed

args.name: upsert
args.info: yes to update member if present, no to raise error in case of a duplicate member (default)

blocks.name: deleteMember
blocks.description: Delete a mailing list member.

blocks.name: validateAddress
blocks.description: Given an arbitrary address, validates address based off defined checks.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailGun.

args.name: address
args.info: An email address to validate. (Maximum: 512 characters)

args.name: mailboxVerification
args.info: If set to true, a mailbox verification check will be performed against the address.
